text: The recombinant MP-12 encoding NSs truncation or mutation were recovered by using a plasmid combination of pProT7-M(+), pProT7-L(+), pT7-IRES-vN, pT7-IRES-vL, pCAGGS-vG and either of pProT7-S(+)PTNSs or pProT7-S(+)SFSNSs. BHK/T7-9 cells were transfected with those plasmids as described previously [51] . Recombinant MP-12 encoding NSs of PTV Adames or SFSV were designated as rMP12-PTNSs or rMP12-SFSNSs, respectively. Recovered recombinant MP-12 were amplified once in VeroE6 cells, titrated by plaque assay, and used for experiments. In addition, we also generated recombinant MP-12 encoding C-terminus Flag-tagged NSs of PTV Adames or SFSV, and those mutants were designated as rMP12-PTNSs-Flag or rMP12-SFSNSs-Flag, respectively.
